Evidence Statements: The student can draw the material before heating or cooling, such as a block of ice.
The student can draw the material after heating, such as ice melting into water.
The student can draw the material after cooling again, showing the water refreezing back into ice.
The student can use arrows or labels in their drawing to show the change from ice to water and back to ice, illustrating the reversible process.
The student can include a brief caption or label explaining why the change from ice to water and back to ice is a reversible change.
